page.title: 10EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Burgess Hill is a rapidly{expanding town in West Sussex. The pattern of employment is changing because of industrial development and an increase in housing. In the past{farming}had an important place in the community and many people were employed in agriculture. The town then developed a {brick and pottery industry.}Now people find employment on the{factory estate. Industry is light and varied, jobs are in warehouses, factories and manufacturing.Many people{commute}to London, Brighton and Crawley.{Gatwick {Airport,}the second largest in Great Britain, also provides employment for many local residents. There are{low unemployment figures in this area, compared with the national average. Opportunities arise locally for young people to take part in the Youth Employment Scheme.
